item.title: Covid-19 pandemic: Japan widens emergency over 'frightening' spike
item.description: The Olympics host is facing record Covid case numbers, fuelled by the virulent Delta strain.

item.title: Prof Chris Whitty: Man sentenced for St James's Park assault
item.description: Lewis Hughes says he lost his job after assaulting England's chief medical officer in central London.

item.title: Covid-19: One in four coronavirus patients in hospital for other reasons, and surge in Japan
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Friday evening.

item.title: Shriever takes BMX gold as GB claim six medals
item.description: Bethany Shriever claimed a thrilling BMX gold and Duncan Scott extended his streak in the pool as Great Britain won six Olympic medals on Friday.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Russians face backlash from fellow competitors
item.description: The Russian Olympic Committee are fourth in the medal table at the Tokyo Games but their athletes are facing questions from fellow competitors about whether they should even be there.

item.title: Hunt for certainty over Covid cases continues
item.description: Flurry of Covid data does not resolve debate around state of the pandemic in the UK.

item.title: Briton killed in oil tanker attack in Arabian Sea
item.description: Two crew members, a British and a Romanian citizen, are killed in an incident off the coast of Oman.

item.title: Esther Dingley: Remains confirmed as those of missing hiker
item.description: Esther Dingley disappeared in the Pyrenees mountains in November.

item.title: One in four Covid patients in hospital for other reasons
item.description: The government says counting all patients who test positive is vital because of the impact on the NHS.

item.title: Stonehenge tunnel campaigners win court battle
item.description: A judicial review into road works near the world heritage site finds for the campaigners.

item.title: 'Brighton cat killer' Steven Bouquet jailed for stabbing 16 pets
item.description: Steven Bouquet has been jailed for more than five years after he killed nine cats in night attacks.

item.title: Apsana Begum: Labour MP cleared of fraudulent housing claims
item.description: Apsana Begum says the trial caused her "great distress" and damaged her reputation.

item.title: End self-isolation for double-jabbed sooner, says Sir Keir Starmer
item.description: Labour is calling on Boris Johnson to bring England in to line with Wales on quarantine measures.

item.title: Critics praise 'defiant' Billie Eilish album
item.description: The teen megastar's second album, Happier Than Ever, gives an unflinching portrayal of global fame.

item.title: The X Factor: 'It's always something I'm proud of'
item.description: Former X Factor contestants on what it was like to star in one of the biggest show on TV.

item.title: Turkey fires: Blazes threaten Marmaris and other coastal resorts
item.description: Villages and hotels are evacuated as firefighters attempt to put out dozens of blazes.

item.title: Olympics: The hidden sight of Tokyo's homeless
item.description: For many among Tokyo's homeless community the Olympics are far from a cause for celebration.

item.title: Rapper ENNY talks sexual consent in latest track
item.description: The rising south London rapper talks about art imitating life in her new single.

item.title: Are America's unvaccinated changing their minds?
item.description: Timothy lives in a county where only a third are fully jabbed - he says he regrets his choice now.

item.title: Cheerleader Sarah Frei's fight back after having both legs amputated
item.description: A drunk driver changed teenager Sarah Frei’s life, but a year on, she’s determined to stay positive.

item.title: Russian module mishap destabilises International Space Station
item.description: The ISS was pushed out of position after engines on a new Russian module unexpectedly fired up.

item.title: Disease killing 'Europe's oldest' elm tree
item.description: Believed to almost 800 years old, the Beauly elm has been laser-scanned as part of work to document it.

item.title: ‘I'm black, my partner's white - stop asking me if this is my baby’
item.description: When Ena Miller had a baby, she was unprepared for the constant comments about her daughter's skin tone.

item.title: Drug deaths in Scotland reach new record level
item.description: The country continues to have the worst drug death rate in Europe, with a further 1,339 people dying last year.

item.title: Proms conductor: 'We're going to play our hearts out'
item.description: Dalia Stasevska discusses the pressures of a pandemic Proms, and the return of Rule, Britannia!

item.title: China warns UK as carrier strike group approaches
item.description: A fleet of British ships is currently sailing through the South China Sea en route to Japan.

item.title: 'I was asked how often I use the toilet'
item.description: Disabled jobseekers have to overcome too many barriers, MPs say.

item.title: The Strokes Is This It at 20: Nudes, booze and 9/11
item.description: How the New York City band's 2001 debut album heralded "a new spirit in guitar music".

item.title: Ballymena: Rare cancer diagnosis leads to unlikely friendship
item.description: Cat McKenna and Amber Scott met after being diagnosed with neuroendocrine cancer.

item.title: Dressage: How to make a horse dance
item.description: For some, it's an oddity to watch only at the Olympics... for others, it's a lifetime of training.

item.title: The seaweed farmers with high hopes for their harvest
item.description: Kelp grown off the coast of the Isle of Skye could be used in food, packaging and cosmetic products.

item.title: The fungus and bacteria tackling plastic waste
item.description: Bacteria, fungus and enzymes can all digest plastic, but can they work at a useful commercial scale?

item.title: Covid and a coup: The double crisis pushing Myanmar to the brink
item.description: A surge in virus cases has dealt a fresh blow to a country already dealing with military coup.

item.title: England's Stokes to take 'indefinite break' from all cricket
item.description: Ben Stokes "will take an indefinite break from all cricket with immediate effect" and has withdrawn from England's Test squad for the series against India.

item.title: Ben White: Arsenal sign England defender from Brighton in £50m deal
item.description: Arsenal sign England "intelligent defender" Ben White from Brighton & Hove Albion in £50m deal.

item.title: Valtteri Bottas fastest in Hungarian Grand Prix second practice
item.description: Valtteri Bottas leads Lewis Hamilton in a Mercedes one-two ahead of Red Bull's Max Verstappen in second practice at the Hungarian Grand Prix.

item.title: 'It hits like a train' - GB 'devastated' by Olympic exit
item.description: GB head coach Hege Riise says there is "no-one to blame" after the 4-3 quarter-final defeat by Australia at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Relive how GB's Bethany Shriever and Kye Whyte won historic BMX medals
item.description: Watch the best bits from GB's history-making day in the BMX racing finals, as Britain's Bethany Shriever wins gold in the women's final and Kye Whyte takes silver in the men's final.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Five reasons why Saturday's women's 100m will light up Olympics
item.description: Five reasons why the women's 100m will be one of the standout events on Saturday at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Two medals, no gold - what has gone wrong with GB rowing?
item.description: Team GB finishes 14th in the rowing medal table after winning only two medals at Tokyo 2020. So where did it all go wrong?

item.title: Women's Olympic football: GB suffer dramatic extra time defeat to Australia
item.description: Great Britain suffer a heartbreaking extra-time defeat by Australia in the Olympic women's football quarter-finals.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Bethany Shriever wins gold for GB in women's BMX final
item.description: Britain's Bethany Shriever wins gold in the women's BMX racing final, holding off two-time champion Mariana Pajon.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Bryony Page wins trampolining bronze for second Olympic medal
item.description: Great Britain's Bryony Page claims her second Olympic medal as she wins bronze in the women's trampolining final.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Simone Biles apparatus finals in doubt because of continuing 'twisties'
item.description: US gymnast Simone Biles says she is still struggling with the 'twisties', raising doubts about whether she will compete in the apparatus finals.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Alexander Zverev beats Novak Djokovic to reach final
item.description: Novak Djokovic's hopes of winning a 'Golden Slam' are over after losing to Alexander Zverev in the Olympic tennis semi-finals.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Dina Asher-Smith into 100m semis as Ta Lou, Fraser-Pryce & Thompson-Herah set pace
item.description: Dina Asher-Smith starts her bid to become the first British woman to win an Olympic individual sprint gold with progress in the 100m heats.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Ben Whittaker and Pat McCormack wins secure boxing medals
item.description: Great Britain's Ben Whittaker and Pat McCormack are both guaranteed Olympic medals after winning their respective fights on Friday.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Duncan Scott wins third medal with silver in 200m medley
item.description: Duncan Scott wins his third medal of the Tokyo Olympics and Great Britain's sixth in the pool with silver in the men's 200m individual medley.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Medal table - which country has won most golds?
item.description: Which country is leading the medal table? How are Great Britain getting on? Medals table for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Day-by-day guide to the key events, big stars and British medal hopes
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in Tokyo? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action in Japan.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Take a tour of the incredible venues
item.description: They range from an arena built by a father and son, to a legendary home of Japanese martial arts.

item.title: Covid: What's the advice for pregnant women and those who haven't had the jab?
item.description: Doctors and midwives are seeing a rise in unprotected pregnant women in hospital with Covid.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: ‘Covid passports’: How to get the NHS Covid Pass
item.description: People in England can use the pass for travel and to visit venues which ask for them.

item.title: Covid symptoms: Is it a cold or coronavirus?
item.description: With similar symptoms, deciding whether or not you need to get tested for coronavirus can be tricky.

item.title: The EU vaccine 'passport' and what it means for travel
item.description: An EU vaccine "passport" is being introduced, enabling holders to prove they have been jabbed.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: All over-18s can now get the Covid jab, but the government has criticised take-up among young people.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the NHS test-and-trace system and app work?
item.description: A record number of alerts are being sent by the NHS Covid app.

item.title: Coronavirus: Four numbers that reveal the real trends
item.description: Does a week of falling case numbers mean we're close to the end?

item.title: Covid: Who has to self-isolate, which workers are exempt and what if I'm fully vaccinated?
item.description: A small number of named employees in key sectors will be exempt from some rules

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid passports: How do they work around the world?
item.description: How are countries enforcing vaccine passports and what can people use them for?

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: People vaccinated in Europe or the US will no longer need to isolate when arriving from amber countries.

item.title: Covid rules: What has changed?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Lockdown muscle loss: Five ways to get back in shape
item.description: Lockdown inactivity may have left people with weaker muscles - there are simple solutions.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Covid vaccines: How fast is progress around the world?
item.description: Charts and maps tracking the progress of Covid vaccination programmes.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The progress made in vaccinating the country's adult population, as more than 46 million people have received at least one dose.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Care homes worst hit by Covid – search the data
item.description: Figures from Care Quality Commission lay out the pandemic's 'devastating impact' on care homes in England.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Tokyo Olympic Games: When are they and how will Covid affect them?
item.description: The Tokyo Summer Olympics have begun, despite a surge in Covid cases in Japan.

item.title: Covid: Why is social distancing coming to an end?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.
